title: Impact of Economic Uncertainty, Geopolitical Risk, Pandemic, Financial & Macroeconomic Factors on Crude Oil Returns -- An Empirical Investigation. (arXiv:2310.01123v1 [econ.EM])
abstract: This study aims to use simultaneous quantile regression (SQR) to examine the impact of macroeconomic and financial uncertainty including global pandemic, geopolitical risk on the futures returns of crude oil (ROC). The data for this study is sourced from the FRED (Federal Reserve Economic Database) economic dataset; the importance of the factors have been validated by using variation inflation factor (VIF) and principal component analysis (PCA). To fully understand the combined effect of these factors on WTI, study includes interaction terms in the multi-factor model. Empirical results suggest that changes in ROC can have varying impacts depending on the specific period and market conditions. The results can be used for informed investment decisions and to construct portfolios that are well-balanced in terms of risk and return. translated_title: 经济不确定性、地缘政治风险、疫情、金融和宏观经济因素对原油回报的影响——实证研究
translated_abstract: 本研究旨在使用同时分位数回归（SQR）来研究宏观经济和金融不确定性对原油期货回报（ROC）的影响，包括全球疫情、地缘政治风险等因素。研究数据来自FRED（美联储经济数据库）经济数据集，使用变异膨胀因子（VIF）和主成分分析（PCA）来验证因素的重要性。为了全面理解这些因素对WTI的综合影响，研究在多因子模型中包含交互项。实证结果表明，ROC的变化可能会根据特定时期和市场条件产生不同的影响。这些结果可用于明智的投资决策和构建风险和收益平衡的投资组合。结构性变化，如全球经济状况的变化或对原油需求的转变，可以导致原油回报对其变化敏感。
tldr: 本研究使用同时分位数回归方法，研究了宏观经济和金融不确定性对原油期货回报的影响。研究发现，这些因素对原油回报的影响在不同时期和市场条件下存在差异。这些结果可用于指导投资决策和构建风险与收益平衡的投资组合。
en_tdlr: This study uses simultaneous quantile regression to examine the impact of macroeconomic and financial uncertainty on crude oil futures returns. The results show that the effects of these factors on crude oil returns vary depending on the specific period and market conditions. This information can be utilized for informed investment decisions and portfolio construction with a balanced risk-return profile.
